page.title: 10THE EXMOOR HUNT SONG
page.content:
Words by Henry Newbolt,this most popular local song traces a Stag Hunt from Bratton Fleming to{Porlock Bay. The song ends: He's gone by Kittuck and{Lucott Moor, He's gone by{Woodcock's Ley, In the little white town they've turn- ed him down Now he's swimming in the open sea. CHORUS: So hurry along,the stag's on foot The Master's up and away, Halloo,halloo,we'll follow him through From Bratton to{Porlock Bay.
So hurry along,we'll both be in, And the field's a parish away, In a field of two we followed him through From Bratton to{Porlock Bay.
